meanings.definition: A person or thing that trundles.
meanings.sent1: The trundlers at the park were happily rolling along the path.
meanings.sent2: The delivery trundlers brought packages to our door every day.
meanings.sent3: The trundlers in the toy store seemed to have a race when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The trundlers of time never stop, always moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The trundlers in the factory made the work efficient and smooth.

meanings.definition: A wheeled device used for moving heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The warehouse trundlers helped transport boxes across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The construction trundlers made it easier to move the heavy equipment.
meanings.sent3: The trundlers in the moving company were always in high demand.
meanings.sent4: The trundlers in the factory were like silent helpers, moving things effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The trundlers in the airport efficiently carried luggage from one place to another.

meanings.definition: A type of rolling pin used in baking.
meanings.sent1: The pastry chef used the trundlers to flatten the dough evenly.
meanings.sent2: The trundlers in the bakery were essential for making perfect pastries.
meanings.sent3: The trundlers in the kitchen were always covered in a dusting of flour.
meanings.sent4: The trundlers in the bakery rolled out delicious treats every day.
meanings.sent5: The trundlers in the pastry shop were well-loved by the bakers for their precision.
